=========================================	O
1	O
Whether	O
Reporters	O
of	O
Local	O
Papers	O
may	O
be	O
allowed	O
to	O
see	O
the	O
judgment	O
?	O
2	O
To	O
be	O
referred	O
to	O
the	O
Reporter	O
or	O
not	O
?	O
3	O
Whether	O
their	O
Lordships	O
wish	O
to	O
see	O
the	O
fair	O
copy	O
of	O
the	O
judgment	O
?	O
4	O
Whether	O
this	O
case	O
involves	O
a	O
substantial	O
question	O
of	O
law	O
as	O
to	O
the	O
interpretation	O
of	O
the	O
constitution	O
of	O
India,	O
1950	O
or	O
any	O
order	O
made	O
thereunder	O
?	O
5	O
Whether	O
it	O
is	O
to	O
be	O
circulated	O
to	O
the	O
civil	O
judge	O

==================================================	O
Shri	O
R.N.	B-LAWYER
Tripathi	I-LAWYER
,	O
Advocate	O
for	O
the	O
petitioners.	O
Shri	O

Tiwari	I-LAWYER
,	O

General	O
for	O
the	O
respondents/State.	O
==================================================	O
Whether	O
Approved	O
for	O
Reporting:	O
Yes	O
==================================================	O
Law	O
Laid	O
Down:	O
The	O
Motor	O
Vehicles	O
Act,	O
1988	O
being	O
the	O
Central	O
Legislation	O
does	O
not	O
contemplate	O
grant	O
of	O
fitness	O
certificate	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
left	O
to	O
be	O
framed	O
by	O
the	O
State	O
Government,	O
therefore,	O
the	O
issue	O
of	O
fitness	O
certificate	O
and	O
payment	O
of	O
tax	O
falls	O
within	O
the	O
legislative	O
competence	O
of	O
the	O
State	O
in	O
terms	O
of	O
Section	O
65(2)(d)	O
of	O
the	O
Act	O
of	O
1988	O
and	O
under	O
Section	O
3	O
of	O
the	O
M.P.	O
Motoryan	O
Karadhan	O
Adhiniyam,	O
1991.	O
Thus,	O
Sub-Rule	O
(2)	O
of	O
Rule	O
48	O
of	O
the	O
M.P.	O
Motor	O
Vehicles	O
Rules,	O
1994	O
contemplating	O
requirement	O
of	O
no	O
dues	O
certificate	O
for	O
grant	O
of	O
fitness	O
certificate,	O
cannot	O
be	O
said	O
to	O
be	O
beyond	O
the	O
legislative	O
competence	O
of	O
the	O
State	O
Government.	O
There	O
is	O
a	O
presumption	O
that	O
the	O
official	O
acts	O
are	O
performed	O
regularly	O
in	O
terms	O
of	O
Sub-section	O
(e)	O
of	O
Section	O
114	O
of	O
the	O
Evidence	O
Act	O
and	O
so	O
is	O
the	O
presumption	O
of	O
correctness	O
of	O
information	O
available	O
on	O
the	O
website.	O
Hence,	O
the	O
web	O
portal	O
of	O
the	O
Department	O
should	O
have	O
entire	O
data	O
of	O
tax	O
paid	O
of	O
each	O
of	O
the	O
vehicle.	O
Further,	O
the	O
aggrieved	O
person	O
should	O
be	O
given	O
an	O
option	O
of	O
submitting	O
online	O
request	O
to	O
reconcile	O
such	O
payment.	O
The	O
State	O
Government	O
to	O
make	O
such	O
amendment	O
in	O
the	O
software.	O
Significant	O
Paragraph	O
Nos.	O
12,	O
13,	O
14,	O
16	O
and	O
17	O

of	O

(`Ssfc'	O
hereafter)	O

Midha	I-JUDGE
1.	O
Whether	O
Reporters	O
of	O
Local	O
papers	O
may	O
Yes	O
be	O
allowed	O
to	O
see	O
the	O
Judgment?	O
2.	O
To	O
be	O
referred	O
to	O
the	O
Reporter	O
or	O
not?	O
Yes	O
3.	O
Whether	O
the	O
judgment	O
should	O
be	O
Yes	O
